forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 64, with temperatures falling to around 61 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 49. West wind 8 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco this afternoon, the sun is making a valiant effort to break through the lingering marine layer, offering glimpses of brightness tempered by a gentle West wind, hinting at a mild day. As the hours pass, temperatures slowly descend from a pleasant height, inviting anyone outdoors to savor the cool air marked by low clouds refusing to fully yield to the sun’s rays. The cityscape may be partially obscured by that characteristic San Francisco fog, softly cloaking the areas nearer to the ocean, while the central parts of the city bask in a subdued clarity.

As evening approaches, the sky will transition into a partly cloudy canvas, perfectly fitting for an early night stroll through the quieter streets, perhaps grabbing a warm drink to accompany the fresh breeze that whispers past. For those venturing out, layers will be your ally—a light jacket wrapped over a breathable shirt should keep you comfortable as day gives way to the chill of night. With the charm of San Francisco’s intimacy illuminated under the faded sunlight, it’s an ideal moment to explore the local coffee shops or art galleries, where one might quietly immerse themselves in the gentle hum of everyday life.
